title: Another fantastic meal
text: Went with friends for Sunday lunch. All had the roast. Three pork and one beef. Once again the meal was excellent as were the puddings. Got as busy as social distancing would allow. Hope the pub gets through these difficult times as there are too many closing down at the moment. The beer garden is great, very neat and tidy with plenty of tables and on a sunny day would be great to sit there and have a beer. Long may it continue. I am related but by no means has this influenced my opinion.

title: With friends
text: Took friends for Sunday carvery. Great Yorkshire puddings. Excellent meal. The desert was to die for. Very friendly guy behind the carvery deck.( I have to say he is my nephew) but this hasn't influenced my review. If it wasn't good I'd have written nothing. Good selection of beer as well. Enjoyed it immensely.

title: So good we went back
text: Had a couple of meals in other restaurants close to our hotel. The meal we had in Gods Restaurant was so good we went back on our last night. It wasn't a fluke, the next meal was as good if not better. The waiters were very friendly and we were made very welcome. After our second visit we felt like family. Go there or regret it.

title: Fantastic
text: Great building with a fantastic collection of ancient artifacts. Very interesting and if history had been as exciting as this when I was at school I'd have taken more interest.

title: . Great visit
text: Another site to tick off in the task book of life. Getting a good selection now but this is near the top. Amazing views.

title: Amazing
text: Photographs don't do it any justice. You have to stand next to it. Its a good walk to the top but once you are there the views are worth it. Amazing!

title: Excellent Service.
text: Four day trip to Athens with friends. Pre booked Georges taxis to pick us up from the airport and return us after our visit. Could not have wished for a better service . Both drivers were friendly, punctual, very knowledgeable and gave us some great tips that enhanced our trip. Alex picked us up from the airport and John took us back.Excellent service. Couldn't fault it

title: Seen it
text: Go there. Amazing sight. Didn't go in because of the queues but it was a great thing to see. Walked along the shore to see other great statues and squares.

title: its a castle
text: At the top of the hill. Got there by tram. A very nice quite place and the views over the city are fantastic. Go there and tick it off in your task book of life.

title: Amazing
text: Stepping back in time really. Not sure where we had to get off but the tram ride was so hairy we decided to stay on it. Got us up most of the hill to the castle. Got off before it started to go down the hill. good trip and not expensive.

title: Great restaurant
text: The last meal of our four day break. possibly the best steak I have ever had. All of our meals were fantastic. The service was great and the waiters were very friendly. A great end to our holiday.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel. Very central,great staff, friendly and helpful. Rooms were spotless and cleaned every day. We are fussy and couldn't fault it. The shower was great. The lounge was very well laid out. Breakfast was light/continental. Free coffee and Port, water and tea etc.and the bar was not expensive. Would defiantly stay there again. and recommend it.
place: Heritage Avenida Liberdade, a Lisbon Heritage Collection

title: Very different Sunday
text: Went with friends in a group of six. Apprehensive at first even more so when we saw the venue. Don't be put off. Did the Hotel Hostage. Very amusing and clever. Got us all working together and we managed to get out in 45 minutes......with help and a clue. A very different, but amusing way to spend an hour or so on a Sunday. The Staff were very helpful and friendly.

title: Fantastic pub
text: Six of us went for lunch after 'City Maze' experience. We were a bit early but were made welcome and a table was soon sorted for us. All had roast dinners. Great food, great puddings, great atmosphere, good range of drinks, friendly staff. Fantastic pub with a happy ambiance and very busy. The toilets were spotless which is always a good sign. I think you would need to book.Wish it was nearer to where I live.

title: Terrible
text: Visited our local Wetherspoons for lunch today with visiting family, we have used this pub chain all around the country and have to say our "local" is the worst we have been in. We ordered lunch for six of us and were advised of a 30 minute wait, after 40 minutes we checked on the progress of our order, 5 minutes later the one starter ordered arrived but the waitress walked away with cutlery in hand, after a further wait we checked on the main courses again only to be told that the Hog Dog wasn't available, so we re-ordered and waited again. Finally the food arrived most of it was cold apart from the "cooked" cucumber in the salad side. Clearly this had been sat under a hot lamp, after complaining once again we were offered free desserts. It wasn't especially busy, we have seen it much busier and sadly have had this problem once before in The Lantokay, there wont be a third time.

title: Short stay in London
text: Good position and very quite. Not far from the tube. Staff, as always, were very helpful and friendly. Very clean. Couldn't fault it really. Would stay again just for the scrambled egg at breakfast. Nice restaurant.
place: Premier Inn London Southwark (Tate Modern) Hotel

title: Nieces Wedding
text: Our stay at the Brookfield was to attend our neices wedding on the 21st May and the reception was being held at the hotel. It was a great venue. The function room was laid out beautifully, the food was excellent and the staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Jamie, the events co -ordinator, assured the reception ran very smoothly and nothing was too much trouble. We really did enjoy our stay and would highly recomend it.
